item.description:
Looking for a job experience abroad? Thinking of studying in Europe, or pursuing your professional career on the other side of the ocean? Then this is for you: we cordially invite you to join us at the 14th European Career Fair at MIT. Discover the many opportunities that international companies, academic institutions and non-profit organizations of the “Old Continent” have to offer!

The 14th European Career Fair in short
· January 29, 2010 - Panel discussions and workshops hosted by the European Commission.
· January 30, 2010 - Career Fair Day with exhibits and presentations by representatives from industry, academia and research.
· January 31 – February 1, 2010 - Interviews for selected candidates. ECF-affiliated seminars on career development, opportunities and other activities!

Why should I attend?
· ECF is the largest career fair of its kind in the US with more than 100 companies and over 3000 participants.
· ECF aims to represent the full breadth of the European job market. Whether you are looking for a job in industry or in the non-profit sector.
· ECF welcomes candidates from all backgrounds and all levels of experience.
· Our searchable database allows employers to view your resume, and schedule interviews with selected candidates.
· In addition, you will have the opportunity to connect with many employers on the day of the Fair!

For more information visit our website at www.euro-career.com!

Here is a link to a map of MIT with the locations of the career fair: https://www.euro-care.... If you have any questions about the fair, you can contact Catherine at cjchomat@yahoo.com.

I'm posting this as an event even though I'm not going to be able to be there. I thought there might be members interested in going. So we will not be meeting at the fair as a group.

group.name: The Boston Euro Social Meetup Group

item.name: MIT European Career Fair
